Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2011 03:49PM afield wrote: I'm scheduled for March 4 - single mastectomy with DIEP at the same time.  Only have DCIS so far so they don't think radiation or chemo necessary, but there were enough locations that need to come out that we're going the mastectomy route instead of BCS.  Trying not to get too nervous about the whole big surgery and recovery thing, but that is wearing thing.  I'm also in the group of I-just-need-to-get-this-thing-done.  At least my kids seem ok with the whole deal and that makes it much easier for me to handle.  Sasha

Posts.Content: Mar 20, 2011 08:25PM afield wrote: Checking back into this thread finally - don't know how I missed it the past few days.  First, thanks for all the well wishes before I went in :-)  I know they all must have helped as it went well.  I'm home and recovering well with my kids and cats and husband.   Going for little walks each day - and each day going a bit further (the kids joke that they take turns 'taking mom for a walk' - sort of like the dog we told them we wouldn't get. . .).  Since I did DIEP at the same time, I'm still working towards being able to stand up straight - so you can imagine how silly I look walkig down the block in my jammies and coat ;-) Second, best wishes to all of you going in in the coming week.  I now have energy again to be able to send lots of it out to the rest of you!
